image.altText: A roll of barbed wire atop a prison wall at night.

props.synopsis: A teenager has taken their own life inside WA's controversial youth detention centre Banksia Hill, the ABC understands, becoming the second child to die in youth detention in the state in less than a year.

title.children: Teenager dies by suicide inside Banksia Hill, second child to die in youth detention in WA in less than a year

image.altText: Doctor holds child in an emergency room at hospital. There are three people surrounding the man and child.

props.synopsis: Emergency physician Mohammed Mustafa has recently returned home from volunteering in two of Gaza's hospitals, and he says the situation there is a "humanitarian catastrophe".

title.children: 'I felt compelled to help': A Perth doctor's account from the hospitals of Gaza

image.altText: Bee on flower

props.synopsis: After four consecutive dry winters, beekeepers in Western Australia are warning of diminished hives and biodiversity loss as fewer flowers bloom and pollen dries up.

title.children: Honey supply under threat in Australia as native flowers fail to bloom

image.altText: Damaged ship with mast down at port with a shipping container in the background

props.synopsis: Two people are injured following a collision between a large container ship and a training vessel at a Perth port.

title.children: Two people injured as container ship collides with training vessel at Perth port

image.altText: A phone inside a mug that says 'have a nice day'.

props.synopsis: On December 12, 2022, three innocent people were ambushed by extremists and murdered in cold blood in a country Queensland town. Why it occurred may never be fully understood.

title.children: It started as a routine police call. By the end of the night, six people were dead

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: We asked you for tips on how to save money in the cost-of-living crunch, on everything from fuel, insurance, mobile phones to food and healthcare. This is what you told us.

title.children: From fuel and phones to food and insurance — tips and tricks to save money amid a cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: A mother and daughter stand on a school basketball court.

props.synopsis: With Western Australia home to some of the most isolated towns in the country, finding a suitable high school can take an emotional and financial toll on parents.

title.children: Rural areas struggle 10 years on from the year 7 school transition

image.altText: A wide shot of the District Court in Perth with two men walking towards its doors.

props.synopsis: A Perth aged care worker who admitted forcing a resident aged in his 80s and living with dementia to perform a sex act is sentenced to two years in prison.

title.children: 'Deep feeling of shame': Perth aged care worker jailed for making elderly man perform sex acts

image.altText: An artist's impression of the proposed development at Port Douglas.

props.synopsis: When Australian investors tipped millions into a large investment fund, they probably didn't expect it would go towards an event with boxer Floyd Mayweather or a penthouse for the wife of a property developer whose fortunes are tied to the fund. But that's exactly what the corporate watchdog has alleged.

title.children: Corporate watchdog claims investment money may have been used to buy $4.5m penthouse for developer's wife

image.altText: Mattijs Bellers of Netherlands in action against Frank Ponder of Australia

props.synopsis: The Rollers — two-time Paralympic gold medallists — meet the Netherlands in their first game in the men's wheelchair basketball. Follow live.

title.children: Rollers aiming to end day one on a high after para-swimmers begin medal haul

image.altText: A phone inside a mug that says 'have a nice day'.

props.synopsis: On December 12, 2022, three innocent people were ambushed by extremists and murdered in cold blood in a country Queensland town. Why it occurred may never be fully understood.

title.children: It started as a routine police call to a property in Wieambilla. By the end of the night, six people were dead

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears a stern expression on his face as he sits in the House of Reps

props.synopsis: The prime minister overturns a decision earlier this week to omit a new question on sexuality being added to the national census, after several Labor MPs spoke out against the move.

title.children: Albanese backs down on decision to exclude LGBT question from next census

image.altText: Sheets of metal are wrapped round a powerline in the middle of several houses

props.synopsis: The storm has caused the death of three people as it moves towards central Japan including the capital Tokyo.

title.children: Typhoon Shanshan forces millions to evacuate as damage intensifies

image.altText: A dentist attends to a patient at an RFDS dental clinic

props.synopsis: Dental healthcare gets left on the back burner for Australians who can't afford day-to-day costs, as patients who rely on public dental care face lengthy wait times.

title.children: Taking loans to fix teeth, choosing to make rent over dentist fees. Australians reveal true toll of dental care neglect

image.altText: A small boy with tears in his eyes is held by his mother as a doctor works at a desk behind him

props.synopsis: The Israeli military and Palestinian militant group have agreed to pause fighting over three separate periods to allow WHO staff to vaccinate children for polio across the besieged enclave.

title.children: Israel and Hamas agree to three-day pauses in hostilities for Gaza polio campaign

image.altText: Singer Robbie Williams dressed in all one colour raises his arms in the air as he performs at the AFL Grand Final at the MCG.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Supreme Court found grand prix organisers misled a music touring company about messages received from then-chief health officer Brett Sutton during the pandemic.

title.children: Australian Grand Prix ordered to pay $2.8m to Robbie Williams promoter over concert cancelled by COVID

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: ACT Policing has issued a warning to the community after two people died yesterday from suspected drug overdoses.

title.children: Public health warning issued after two people die from suspected drug overdoses in Canberra

image.altText: Hands hold up a gold, silver and bronze medal

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes won overnight — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here are the medal standings after day one of the Paralympic Games

image.altText: A supermarket worker putting up a sign in Japanese on a rice shelf.

props.synopsis: Japanese supermarkets across the country have run out of rice stocks, with consumer stockpiling at least partly to blame. So what can be done about it?

title.children: Japan is running out of rice. Why are consumers panic-buying?

image.altText: An Adelaide ambulance.

props.synopsis: A senior Royal Adelaide Hospital doctor has been prevented from giving evidence about ambulance ramping to an inquest investigating the deaths of three patients, with the inquiry hearing SA Health had "refused" to allow her to speak on the subject.

title.children: Doctor blocked from giving ambulance ramping evidence after SA Health 'refused', inquest told

image.altText: Side of man's face just visible. He holds phone with 'Bet' on the screen. Blurred TV plays sport in background.

props.synopsis: As Australia prepares for the government to finalise its gambling advertising restrictions, we take a look at what's happened in a nation where bans have already been implemented. Spoiler: Not everything went to plan.

title.children: Australia is set to introduce gambling ad bans, but a nation where they already exist has some warnings

image.altText: A police vehcile parked outside a house surrounded by a trees.

props.synopsis: Police have charged a man with two counts of murder and will allege he failed to contact emergency services after two people were found unresponsive on Thursday.

title.children: Man charged with murder after two people found dead at Brisbane house

image.altText: A man's hands holding a mobile phone trying to onto myGov.

props.synopsis: Scammers are taking advantage of tax time with deceptive emails designed to steal your personal information.

title.children: Have you received an email from myGov recently? You might need to look closer

image.altText: US Army official holds wreath alongside Donald Trump and elderly man

props.synopsis: The US Army confirmed a service member was "abruptly pushed aside" by a member of Trump's team after she tried to stop the Republican camp from filming in Section 60.

title.children: Why has Donald Trump's visit to Arlington National Cemetery caused controversy?

image.altText: David Holmes, looking unhappy, leans on the back of a chair

props.synopsis: After a couple of years working at Southern Cross Station, elevator mechanic David Holmes says he struggled to exercise, was constantly tired and realised his skin was turning yellow.

title.children: Medical report links former worker’s liver damage to diesel fumes at Melbourne's Southern Cross Station

image.altText: Computer illustration of bacteria of different shapes, including cocci and rod-shaped bacteria.

props.synopsis: What bacteria and fungi are in the foods we eat? Scientists have analysed what’s in more than 2,500 different foods to create a ‘food microbiome’.

title.children: It's not just kombucha: Scientists find thousands of unknown microbes in everyday foods

image.altText: Jordan Thompson pumps his fist after winning a point

props.synopsis: Jordan Thompson has claimed the biggest scalp yet at the 2024 US Open to continue Australia's flying start and surge into round three in New York.

title.children: Thompson stuns seventh-seed to advance in US Open as Australian men record a 27-year first

image.altText: Man wearing glasses smiling to camera.

props.synopsis: International students say they're more anxious about getting a spot in an Australian university course, following the federal government's decision to cap the number of applicants.

title.children: These international students are excited to study in Australia, but the new cap makes them 'anxious'

image.altText: Police at the scene of a crash at Port Lincoln.

props.synopsis: The 23-month-old girl was struck by the car along the seaside city's main shopping strip late on Thursday afternoon, and has been taken to Adelaide's Women's and Children's Hospital.

title.children: Toddler taken to hospital in critical condition after being hit by car at Port Lincoln

image.altText: A man in suit.

props.synopsis: Kiingi Tuheitia, New Zealand's Maori king, dies at the age of 69 just days after the celebration of his 18th year on the throne.

title.children: 'A moment of great sadness': Maori King Tuheitia dies at 69 after heart surgery

image.altText: A drone shot shows rows of flooded streets with two people standing in the flooded water, covered up to their knees.

props.synopsis: Almost 2,000 people have been rescued, with the army deployed to assist with relief efforts.

title.children: Dozens killed in India as heavy rain leads to widespread flooding

image.altText: Eduard Sallent holds his right index finger vertically across his lips as listens the question at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Spanish authorities have been after fugitive Catalonian separatist leader Carles Puigdemont for seven years, but when he openly returned to Barcelona, police didn't have a plan to nab him and he vanished again.

title.children: 'We weren't made to look like fools': How a Catalan fugitive says he did, in fact, make police look foolish

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and a pink jacket poses for a photo with soccer jerseys in the background

props.synopsis: Rose Valente loved women's sport, but struggled to find it on the screens at traditional sports bars. So she created her own.

title.children: The Ladies League: Inside Australia's first women's sports bar

image.altText: A collage of three different news stories

props.synopsis: It's time to test your knowledge about news of the week.

title.children: Weekly news quiz:  Hamish Blake's life-changing advice, Paralympics begin, and rumours at the DNC
